message.content:
A Verbena urticifolia is a flowering plant species that belongs to the family Verbenaceae.
It typically grows up to two feet tall and has a spreading habit.
Its leaves are oblong, slightly serrated, and feature a rough texture resembling nettle leaves.
The leaves are also arranged opposite each other on the stem and range in color from dark green to purplish green.
The plant bears tiny pale blue or lavender flowers in dense clusters that attract bees, butterflies, and other pollinators.
The Verbena urticifolia can be found in open fields, meadows, and prairies across the southern and eastern United States.
It is widely used as a culinary herb and also has medicinal properties.
